title: NRO outlines plan to onboard commercial satellite imaging technologies
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is considering a more flexible contracting vehicle to work with commercial remote-sensing companies

title: Military surveillance constellation fuels debate over who calls the shots
summary: U.S. Space Force Lt. Gen. David Miller raises questions over the control and employment of Ground Moving Target Indicator satellites.

title: Xona raises $19 million Series A funds for satellite navigation service
summary: The funding round was led by Steve Jurvetson’s Future Ventures and Seraphim Space

title: NATO seeks assistance in data exploitation
summary: Given the flood of intelligence coming in from 32 members, NATO needs help with rapid exploitation and sense-making.

title: Chang’e-6 enters lunar orbit ahead of far side landing attempt
summary: China’s Chang’e-6 lunar far side sample return spacecraft entered orbit around the moon late Tuesday, in another step towards collecting lunar samples.

title: Starliner Crew Flight Test Slips to May 17 at the Earliest
summary: The launch of Boeing’s Starliner Crew Flight Test has slipped to at least May 17. The United Launch Alliance, which builds and operates the Atlas V rocket, determined that the […]

title: Starliner launch delayed to mid-May
summary: The first crewed flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner will be delayed at least another week and a half to replace a faulty valve in its Atlas 5 launch vehicle.

title: Privateer acquires Orbital Insight
summary: Space situational awareness company Privateer acquired geospatial data analysis firm Orbital Insight in a deal announced May 6.

title: Launch Roundup: Boeing Starliner delayed and China launches new rocket variant
summary: This week was expected to see the maiden launches of two new spacecraft: Boeing’s crewed Starliner spacecraft and the first Chang Zheng 6C rocket from China.

title: NRO expands commercial partnerships
summary: Leaders of the National Reconnaissance Office, the U.S. government agency responsible for designing, building, launching and maintaining America’s intelligence satellites, often cite their commitment to commercial purchases.
